text: Hello how to fetch HubSpot_owner_id on goals api

Hi,
How to get all activities of a contact?

I am getting this error can any one help me with the solution
Event ID already in use, please choose a new unique id - XXXXXX

I wish they had a single reference swagger api doc.
Do you have the link for this particular url that you are trying use?
This link makes it sound doubtful about what you want to do:
<https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/APIs-Integrations/Associate-a-conversation-thread-with-a-contact/m-p/1026269>
what's the api url that you're using for goals?

Hello everyone, wanted to check in on this. Any updates on creating threads using API?
 <https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/archives/C2YHAHB6K/p1704484804620489>

for anyone else looking for this a year later...

This was a bug in earlier versions of the sdk. It is resolved as of 10.0.0
Is it possible to create properties of type `Property Sync` via api?

what's the most confusing thing about all of HubSpot is where does your code (private app, etc) live and run?
Where is your code for this? Do you have a 3rd party account where you can run a lambda or some random piece of code periodically, or when triggered?
Is it inside of HubSpot's workflows or "serverless functions" which doesn't give me a lot of clarity about what I can do with them.
I usually have some script that I want to execute and I just don't know where I can deploy it.

Hi everyone, I'm wanting to update a contacts primary email address if they change their email in our 1st party platform which then syncs to HubSpot. I don't think it's possible to update primary email via API, but I can update secondary email via API (link to doco: <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/contacts#secondary-emails>). Is that correct? If so I'm thinking about a workaround where we update the secondary email address and then have a manual process to go and check and set the new email as primary.
